title: DEPRESSION TEST
description: For people who may be experiencing symptoms of depression, including persistent sadness, loss of interest, and fatigue.
questions: I have lost interest in activities.
I feel tired or have low energy.
I feel hopeless about the future.
I feel restless or slowed down.
I feel life is not enjoyable.

thresholds.advice: Low indicators found. Maintain a healthy routine.
Mild indicators found. Consider talking to someone.
Moderate indicators found. Professional support is recommended.
Significant indicators detected. Reach out to a professional.

title: ADHD TEST
description: For people of all ages who have trouble focusing, remembering things, completing tasks, and/or sitting still.
questions: I have trouble paying attention to details.
I have difficulty staying focused on tasks.
I leave my seat when I shouldn't.
I have difficulty waiting my turn.
I lose things necessary for tasks.
I avoid tasks that require sustained mental effort.

thresholds.advice: Strong likelihood of ADHD traits. Consult a specialist.

title: ANXIETY TEST
description: For those experiencing excessive worry, nervousness, or panic that interferes with daily life.
questions: I feel nervous or on edge.
I experience sudden feelings of panic.
I have difficulty sleeping because of anxiety.
I avoid situations due to worry.
I feel tense in social settings.
I experience stomach discomfort from anxiety.
I feel a sense of impending doom.

thresholds.advice: Results suggest low levels of anxiety.
High levels detected. Seek clinical support.

title: OCD TEST
description: For individuals with recurrent, unwanted thoughts (obsessions) and/or repetitive behaviors (compulsions).
questions: I feel compelled to check things repeatedly.
I feel anxious if things are not in order.
I repeat actions until they ‚Äúfeel right.‚Äù
I avoid situations that trigger obsessions.
I count or repeat words silently.
I spend too much time on rituals.
I experience distress when I try to resist compulsions.
I have fears of harming myself or others.
I feel responsible for preventing harm.
I get stuck on thoughts I can‚Äôt ignore.
I hoard items I don‚Äôt need.
I feel guilty for having intrusive thoughts.

thresholds.advice: High indicators. Specialized therapy is recommended.

title: BIPOLAR TEST
description: For people experiencing significant mood swings, including periods of elevated mood (mania) and periods of depression.
questions: I experience periods of high energy.
I have periods of excessive happiness.
I sleep less than usual but feel energetic.
I feel easily irritated during high energy periods.
I experience irritability during low moods.
I experience rapid shifts between high and low moods.
I feel creative during high moods.
I struggle to maintain relationships due to mood changes.

thresholds.advice: Mood shifts appear within normal range.
Moderate signs of mood instability detected.

title: PSYCHOSIS & SCHIZOPHRENIA TEST
description: For individuals experiencing distortions of reality, such as hallucinations or delusions.
questions: I hear voices others cannot hear.
I see things others cannot see.
I believe people are watching me.
I feel external forces control my thoughts.
I have trouble organizing my thoughts.
I speak in a way others struggle to understand.
I withdraw from family and friends.
I feel emotionally flat or blank.
I find it hard to express emotions.
I have trouble differentiating dreams from reality.
I feel my thoughts are being broadcast.

thresholds.advice: High risk detected. Urgent evaluation advised.

title: EATING DISORDER TEST
description: For those with unhealthy relationships with food, body image concerns, and disordered eating patterns.
questions: I feel unhappy with my body shape.
I avoid eating in front of others.
I restrict food even when I‚Äôm hungry.
I binge eat large amounts of food.
I make myself vomit after eating.
I use laxatives or diet pills to control weight.
I feel out of control when eating.
I compare my body to others.
My weight affects my mood heavily.
I feel ashamed about my eating habits.
I avoid social events involving food.
I feel pressure to be thin.
My body is never good enough.

thresholds.advice: Pay attention to body image habits.
Patterns of disordered eating. Seek support.

title: PTSD TEST
description: For individuals who have experienced trauma and are showing symptoms like flashbacks, nightmares, or avoidance.

thresholds.advice: Moderate PTSD symptoms. Therapy can help.

title: ADDICTION TEST
description: For people concerned about problematic substance use or compulsive behaviors impacting their life.
questions: I consume substances despite negative consequences.
I try to cut down but fail.
I neglect responsibilities due to use.
I spend a lot of time obtaining substance.
I continue use despite health issues.
I feel unable to control use.

thresholds.advice: Substance use behaviors appear low risk.
Possible patterns of dependency. Seek support.

title: STRESS LEVEL TEST
description: Assess how often you feel overwhelmed or unable to cope with daily pressures.
